repnme.cdata!:
Nicaragua - Poverty Reduction Support
            Credit (PRSC) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Poverty Reduction
            Support Credit (PRSC) Project for Nicaragua were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome
            was moderate, Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: Even if all prior actions are met,
            especially in the case of one-tranche operations where all
            such actions are met before Board presentation, the number
            and share of people living in poverty is not reduced. This
            leads to three conclusions. First, welfare changes poor have
            be analyzed, as there might be impacts not necessarily
            reflected in a reduction in the poverty rate. Second, policy
            measures supported by poverty reduction support credit
            (PRSC) may take a longer time to reduce the number of poor
            people than ex-post evaluations may not reveal. There should
            be a better understanding of the timing and mechanisms
            through which these policies affect the poor. In some cases,
            these policies lay the ground for growth to affect poverty,
            although by themselves they may not have a direct and
            immediate effect on the poverty rate. Lastly, policy actions
            may not have been relevant to reduce poverty. Since it is
            Bank policy to support Government-designed poverty reduction
            strategy paper (PRSP), the analysis of these should be
            reinforced to highlight those policies that, in the
            Bank's view, will have a higher probability of
            impacting poverty rates. Close and real coordination with
            other development assistance partners is essential to the
            success and continuity of policy-based lending, as it
            provides the necessary financial and political leverage.
            Single tranche operations, wherein all prior actions are
            accomplished before Board presentation, have less
            operational difficulties and provide the right incentives to
            the borrower, by rewarding for self-determined and
            self-decided actions, rather than buying policy reforms that
            can always be reversed subsequently. Ideally, these should
            be yearly operations. From the borrower's perspective,
            this also allows closer coordination with the national
            budget cycle and more predictability of financial
            assistance. Accordingly, the amount of the operation needs
            to be commensurate with its one-tranche design, as well as
            the timing of intended development objectives. For this to
            be possible, the Bank needs to assign sufficient
            administrative resources for project preparation.

docna.cdata!:
Nicaragua - Poverty Reduction Support Credit
            (PRSC) Project

9685318.majtheme: Human development,Public sector governance,Rural development,Environment and natural resource management,Trade and integration

repnme.cdata!: Budget support for reforms yield results in Nicaragua

abstracts.cdata!:
Nicaragua is one of the poorest
            countries in Latin America and highly dependent on foreign
            aid. Despite recent steady progress in poverty reduction, at
            the launch of the program in 2004, some 46 percent of
            Nicaragua's population lived in poverty, and 15 percent
            in extreme poverty. A poverty reduction strategy, prepared
            through a broad participatory process, identified main focus
            areas for the country's development including better
            governance, broad-based growth, and improved health and
            education status of Nicaraguans. The goal of the first
            poverty reduction support credit (PRSC), one of a series of
            budget support operations, was to support the implementation
            of this national strategy. It provided financial support for
            public institution reforms, better governance,
            competitiveness, and social improvements. The second PRSC
            has already been approved. In addition to focusing on
            poverty reduction, it includes measures in the areas of
            trade, education, land titling, civil service reform, and
            road maintenance. This work will be complemented by other
            specific investments and by analytical work.

docna.cdata!: Budget support for reforms yield results in Nicaragua

Budget support for reforms yield
            results in Nicaragua

24039212.trustfund:
TF052689-PHRD-NICARAGUA: NICARAGUA
            POVERTY REDUCTION SUPPORT CREDIT

repnme.cdata!:
Nicaragua - Poverty Reduction Support
            Credit Project : release of second tranche  - waiver of one condition

abstracts.cdata!:
The Poverty Reduction Support Credit
            (PRSC) approved in January 2004, provided financial
            assistance to Nicaragua to implement the country's
            Poverty Reduction Strategy. The Credit provided support in
            four areas: a) macroeconomic stability and protection of
            poverty expenditure; b) public institutions and governance;
            c) human capital of the poor and vulnerable populations;
            and, d) broad-based growth. Nicaragua made satisfactory
            progress in maintaining a macro-economic framework, and in
            carrying out the Strategy, and, there has also been
            satisfactory progress in respect of the key results
            envisaged in this Credit. Section II discusses the
            macroeconomic situation, Section III assesses progress with
            respect to the Poverty Reduction Strategy, and Section IV
            provides an evaluation of the completion of the nine
            specific actions. Given the delay in the completion of the
            registration does not adversely affect the implementation of
            the overall program supported by the PRSC series, or its
            components, it is proposed that a waiver be granted.
            Nevertheless, in order to reflect this delay, the amount of
            the disbursement would be reduced by SDR 3.5 million (as per
            the Borrower's cancellation of said amount pursuant to
            Section 6.01 of the relevant General Conditions). In
            consultation with the Ministry of Finance and Public Credit,
            FODIEN - Development Fund for the Electricity Industry - has
            been restructured through:1) the necessary modifications of
            FODIEN's legal structure based on an evaluation of such
            structure; 2) the entry into effect of rules and procedures
            for selection, implementation and monitoring of subprojects
            supported by FODIEN; 3) the establishment of funding,
            financing mechanisms and subsidy allocation criteria for
            subprojects; 4) the entry into effect of rules and
            procedures for FODIEN's management; and, 5) the
            adoption of a medium term financing plan of FODIEN,
            consistent with overall fiscal sustainability of the Borrower.

5087130.trustfund:
TF052689-PHRD-NICARAGUA: NICARAGUA
            POVERTY REDUCTION SUPPORT CREDIT

repnme.cdata!:
Nicaragua - Poverty Reduction Support
            Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
of public resources devoted to poverty
            alleviation and the adoption of measures to limit the fiscal
            impact of reforms which have a potential for fiscal
            destabilization, including pension reform and fiscal
            transfers to municipalities. The series of PRSCs will
            support the following subject areas contained in the four
            pillars of the PRSP, with PRSC I emphasizing the first one :
            Building Public Institutions and Governance (Pillar IV), is
            a key factor in the reduction of corruption and the
            achievement of the necessary fiduciary safeguards for
            policy-based lending that would allow more poverty reducing
            assistance. The following key areas will be supported by the
            PRSC: civil service, public investment program and medium
            term expenditure framework, public sector financial
            management, public procurement, civic engagement,
            decentralization and poverty analysis.  The PRSC will
            support the Government's efforts to promote better
            coordination and an effective use of resources, as well as a
            series of reforms in basic education, health, population,
            social protection and water and sanitation. I) The PRSC
            would also support improvements in the investment climate,
            competition policy, access to land and credit, agriculture
            and forestry, and access and quality of infrastructure. The
            proposed operation would contribute to Nicaragua's
            poverty reduction efforts by: (a) increasing the
            accountability, responsiveness and effectiveness of the
            state, (b) directly supporting the achievement of PRSP
            social goals and MDGs including targets for primary school
            completion, improved child health and nutrition, improved
            water coverage, and improved reproductive and maternal
            health care for women, (c) helping to maintain a stable
            macroeconomic framework, (d) improving the country's
            investment climate, better positioning the country to
            benefit from the Central American Free Trade Agreement
            (CAFTA) and regional economic integration initiatives and
            (e) fostering improved donor coordination--a key ingredient
            for increasing the efficiency of aid- by fostering
            sector-wide approaches and strengthening the
            Government's fiduciary processes as the basis for
            harmonized assistance from different external partners.
            Political divisions between the Executive and the Nicaraguan
            National Assembly constitute the biggest source of risk for
            the PRSC. A second source o f risks is related to fiscal
            instability associated with the passage of the Fiscal
            Transfers Law and with pension reform. The Credit will be
            disbursed in two tranches.
